business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: I respect the law, will cooperate: Allu Arjun after walking out of jailI am a law-abiding citizen and will cooperate: Allu Arjun after being released from jail in stampede case

Allu Arjun released from jail after interim bail, 'slept on floor last night'Allu Arjun was arrested from his residence on Friday morning in connection with the Sandhya Theatre stampede case in which a 35-year-old woman died, and her son was injured.
OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji found dead in San Francisco apartmentSuchir Balaji, a whistleblower who formerly worked at AI giant OpenAI, was found dead in his apartment in San Francisco.

Ram Nath Kovind on One Nation One Election: People vote for governance, not pollsFormer President Ram Nath Kovind delved into the ongoing debate around "One Nation, One Election", saying that people cast ballots with governance in mind.

Another day, another tantrum! How to manage your child's anger and stubbornnessEvery parent knows the struggle when their child throws a fit after being told 'no'. It's frustrating, and while you know this behaviour isn't healthy, how should you handle it?

3rd Test Day 1 LIVE: Rain forces early lunch in BrisbaneIND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 1 Live Score and Updates: The incessant rain at the Gabba has forced the umpires to take early lunch on Day 1. Indian bowlers are yet to taste success after 13 overs as the conditions haven't been as threatening as captain Rohit Sharma expected at the toss. Earlier, India won the toss and opted to bowl first as Ravindra Jadeja and Akash Deep came in the playing XI in place of Harshit Rana and R Ashwin. For Australia, Scott Boland made way for Josh Hazlewood.

Trump vows to abolish daylight saving time in US: 'Inconvenient, very costly'US President-elect Donald Trump said his Republican Party will "use its best efforts" to end the practice of adjusting clocks twice a year, calling daylight saving time "inconvenient" and "very costly" to Americans.

So much talk about an arrest, none for stampede victim's family: Revanth ReddySpeaking at the Agenda Aaj Tak event, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed that the police were doing their job but Allu Arjun's arrival at the theatre for the premiere without any intimation to the management as well as the police, had led to the stampede.

Calm, restrained: How Allu Arjun kept emotions in check through arrest and bailAllu Arjun was arrested and granted bail in a matter of five hours. But, it was his calm demeanour that caught everyone's attention.

Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.

AUS vs IND, 3rd Test: Harshit Rana and R Ashwin dropped as India make 2 changes to XIIndia have decided to drop Harshit Rana and R Ashwin for the Brisbane Test with Ravindra Jadeja and Akash Deep coming into the playing XI. India won the toss on Day 1 of the Test on Saturday, December 14.

Congress stokes Allu Arjun wildfire, pours cold water on Priyanka's maiden speechFriday was to be a big day for the Congress with Priyanka Gandhi Vadra delivering her debut Parliament speech. However, the arrest of Pushpa 2 actor Allu Arjun and the subsequent events in Telangana, a Congress-ruled state, drew all cameras and captured all conversations, online and offline.

Pics: Ranbir-Alia, Kareena-Saif and others stun at Raj Kapoor film festivalActors Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Kareena Kapoor, Saif Ali Khan, Prem Chopra among others graced the first day of the Raj Kapoor Film Festival in Mumbai on Friday.

Arvind Kejriwal shrugs off Chief Minister's bungalow row: No attachment to itResponding to questions about the alleged luxury features of the bungalow at 6 Flag Staff Road, Arvind Kejriwal said he vacated the house within three days of resigning as Chief Minister and had no personal attachment to it.

Ravindra Jadeja always been India's first choice overseas spinner: BangarSanjay Bangar backed Ravindra Jadeja's inclusion for the Brisbane Test, calling him India's best spin option in overseas conditions. Jadeja replaced Washington Sundar in India's XI as the team sought to recover from their Adelaide defeat.

Not BJP, AAP was first to talk about financial aid for women: Arvind KejriwalAt the Agenda Aaj Tak event, AAP Chief Arvind Kejriwal defended the Delhi government's Mukhyamantri Mahila Samman Yojna (MMSY), asserting that his party was the first to talk about financial assistance for underprivileged women.
How a boy from Chennai rekindled India's ancient chess spirit At 18, D Gukesh dethrones Ding Liren, becoming the youngest world champion, reigniting India's ancestral flame in global chess mythology.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Strictly follow rules for electoral roll deletion: Poll body to Delhi officials The Election Commission of India has instructed the Chief Electoral Officer of Delhi to ensure transparency and adherence to guidelines while revising the electoral rolls ahead of the assembly elections.

Nana Patole asks Mallikarjun Kharge to relieve him of state chief post: SourcesIn his letter, according to the sources, Nana Patole noted that under his leadership, the party did not perform well in the state assembly elections. Patole also mentioned that he had completed four years in the role and sought to be relieved of his responsibilities.

Vikrant Massey on taking break from work: Wanted to live my lifeActor Vikrant Massey recently announced on Instagram that he is taking a break from movies. Speaking on Day 1 of the Agenda AajTak, he explained that he shared the viral social media post to prioritise his personal life.

Who's Revanth Reddy's favourite Telugu actor? 'I'm a star myself', he saysDuring Agenda Aaj Tak, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy while talking about Allu Arjun's arrest, said, "I am a star myself, I am no one's fan."

Top Hyderabad cop on what went down on the day of Pushpa 2 screening stampedeHyderabad Police claimed that suitable police arrangements were made at the Sandhya Theatre in Hyderabad for the release of Pushpa 2 on December 4 and alleged that it was actor Allu Arjun's actions that led to the stampede.

Aaj Tak is part of people's lives, platform for all: Kalli Purie"Being a leader means always doing something new, envisioning new dreams, and taking new leaps. We strive not just to present the news but also to bring forth stories that can make our country and society better," Kalli Purie said during.

Actor Allu Arjun returns home after interim bail in Hyderabad stampede caseActor Allu Arjun has returned home after being granted interim bail following his arrest in the Sandhya Theatre stampede case during the premiere of Pushpa 2.

Calm, restrained: How Allu Arjun kept emotions in check through arrest and bailAllu Arjun was arrested and granted bail in a matter of five hours. But, it was his calm demeanour that caught everyone's attention.

Pushpa 2: Trade analysts predict lifetime collection of Allu Arjun's filmAllu Arjun's Pushpa 2 has been ruling the ticket counter's like no one's business. We spoke to trade analysts to assess how much the film will end up minting at the box office.

Kangana Ranaut on songs on alcohol, drugs: Artistic expression is about emotionsKangana Ranaut shared her thoughts on songs on substance abuse. Speaking at Agenda AajTak 2024, the actor emphasised that the responsibility doesn't lie solely with artistes, but also with the public.

sports.headline: Watch: Siraj booed at the Gabba as fans still salty about Head spatMohammed Siraj endured boos from Australian fans at the Gabba during Day 1 of the third Test between India and Australia, which came as an effect of his spat with Travis Head in the Adelaide Test.

Mohammad Rizwan rues mini collapse in 2nd T20I loss: That was the differencePakistan skipper Mohammad Rizwan lamented the mini collapse his side suffered during the 2nd T20I and claimed it was the difference in the loss at Centurion  on Friday, December 13. Pakistan lost the series with the defeat in Centurion.

AUS vs IND: Fans bash Rohit Sharma for opting to bowl first in BrisbaneIndia captain Rohit Sharma was heavily trolled on social media for his decision to bowl first during the third Test against Australia at the Gabba in Brisbane.

Jadeja replaced Washington Sundar in India's XI as the team sought to recover from their Adelaide defeat.

Shakib Al Hasan banned from bowling by ECB after action deemed illegalShakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh's star all-rounder, has been suspended from bowling in ECB competitions due to an illegal action. This decision could affect his international career and participation in other tournaments.

Gabba hero Rishabh Pant recalls 'challenging part' during recovery from accidentIndia wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant revealed the most challenging part during his recovery process after his accident in 2022. Pant has been back behind the stumps for India in Tests and has done well with the bat as well.

AUS vs IND, 3rd Test: Harshit Rana and R Ashwin dropped as India make 2 changes to XIIndia have decided to drop Harshit Rana and R Ashwin for the Brisbane Test with Ravindra Jadeja and Akash Deep coming into the playing XI. India won the toss on Day 1 of the Test on Saturday, December 14.

SA vs PAK: Reeza Hendricks 117 powers South Africa to series win over PakistanReeza Hendricks was the star of the show as South Africa chased down 207 runs to win the 2nd T20I against Pakistan and clinch the series on Friday, December 13. Hendricks and Rassie van Der Dussen's partnership ensured that the Proteas won the match by 7 wickets.

SA vs PAK: Saim Ayub stranded at 98* after Pak lower order's blitzkriegSaim Ayub remained stranded at 98* after he didn't get a chance to take a strike in the final over of the 2nd T20I between Pakistan and South Africa.

Babar Azam smashes Gayle's T20 record, completes 14K runs for PakistanSA vs PAK: Babar Azam became the fastest to reach the landmark of 11000 runs in T20s, breaking Chris Gayle's record. He also reached the landmark of 14000 runs in international cricket.

Rajat Patidar's blistering fifty takes Madhya Pradesh to SMAT final after 13 yearsRajat Patidar's unbeaten 66 took Madhya Pradesh to the final of the Sayed Mushtaq Ali 2024 final. They beat Delhi by 7 wickets to set up a clash with Mumbai in the final.

Rahul Dravid's younger son Anvay hits hundred for Karnataka in Vijay Merchant TrophyRahul Dravid's younger son, Anvay, is following the footsteps of his father as the 16-year-old smashed an unbeaten hundred in the Vijay Merchant Trophy for Karnataka.

ICC to finalise hybrid model with PCB chief on SaturdayThe ICC is set to sit with Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Mohsin Naqvi on Saturday to finalise the hybrid model for the Champions Trophy. Neither India nor Pakistan will travel to each other's country for ICC events.

Gukesh creates history, beats Ding Liren to become youngest World Chess Champion India's D Gukesh, an 18-year-old Grand Master, has become the youngest-ever world chess champion after beating defending champion China's Ding Liren in Singapore on Thursday. He also became the second Indian after Viswanathan Anand to lift the title.

Afghanistan bounce back vs Zimbabwe to level series after Rashid-Naveen's heroicsAfghanistan made a stellar comeback to level the 3-match T20I series vs Zimbabwe 1-1. Darwish Rasooli won Player of the Match after hitting maiden T20I fifty

ICC to finalise hybrid model with PCB chief on SaturdayThe ICC is set to sit with Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Mohsin Naqvi on Saturday to finalise the hybrid model for the Champions Trophy. Neither India nor Pakistan will travel to each other's country for ICC events.

He also became the second Indian after Viswanathan Anand to lift the title.

Afghanistan bounce back vs Zimbabwe to level series after Rashid-Naveen's heroicsAfghanistan made a stellar comeback to level the 3-match T20I series vs Zimbabwe 1-1. Darwish Rasooli won Player of the Match after hitting maiden T20I fifty

India Women name squads for West Indies series, Kashyap earns call-up India have given maiden international call-ups to Nandini Kashyap, Raghvi Bisht and Pratika Rawal as they named their ODI and T20I squads for their home series against the West Indies.

Bhuvneshwar Kumar in awe of RCB's comeback in IPL 2024, excited to join teamBhuvneshwar Kumar praised the RCB franchise for their comeback in IPL 2024. He also expressed his excitement on making a return to the same team with which he began his T20 career.

Watch: D Gukesh passes Chess Championship trophy to proud mother D Gukesh's mother was present at the closing ceremony of the World Chess Championship, seeing her son lift the title. On Thursday, Gukesh became the youngest world champion after beating Ding Liren.

3rd Test: Unsung Gabba hero eyes SENA redemption on return to BrisbaneShubman Gill has another opportunity to shine as India face Australia at the Gabba. With memories of his previous heroics in Brisbane still vivid, Gill will look to dominate the proceedings in the third Test, starting December 14.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
